title: Dear Richard Madeley: 'Why should I help my boyfriend settle a debt with his ex?'
text:
Dear Richard

My boyfriend has asked if I can take out an overdraft so he can buy his ex’s share of a car they purchased together five years ago. He is paying her off in instalments, but I think he just wants to be completely free of the relationship. I see that the car is useful to him, though I don’t particularly want us to have one.

I’m genuinely torn. I don’t think he’s going to abscond, and I can see it’s sensible – I can get better terms than he could – but part of me just resents having my money, or my overdraft anyway, going to her, so I’ve said “no”. Am I being unreasonable?

Anon, London SE27
